title: Early British Public Library Buildings - Origins, Condition and Future Prospects
abstractText: This project provides both a social and architectural history of British public library buildings, and an evaluation of their potential for modernisation. An initial survey identifies and classifies surviving pre-1939 library buildings and forms the basis for the architectural history of an important Victorian and early 20th century civic institution with ambitious social objectives and an iconography to support them. In the final phase of the project we will examine case studies of schemes to upgrade historic buildings to meet the present needs of service providers and users.
